page.title: 07Hill Farm Great Alne
page.content: Mr.Bullock was a tennant for 45 years then decided to buy the 84 acre farm two years ago.He has 30 acres of arable and 50 acres of grass.He now has 20 beef steers (which are 18 months old,)49 ewes,2 rams,66 lambs and 1 sheep dog.He also has a pony which he keeps for his daughter. Mr.Bullock also grows crops like barley and oats. The most common disease for sheep is sheep scab.Mr.Bullock has to dip the sheep twice a year.Sometimes a man comes to check to see if the sheep dip is clean after dipping the sheep. Mr. Bullock usually gets up about 07:00 and goes to bed between 10 and 11 0,clock.Sheep are very profitable but cows are not.Limousin and Friesian are the most common cows on that farm.
